intro: Knautia tergestina, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairy and somewhat woody at the base. Knautia tergestina is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
